# Econometric estimation

```{r, include=FALSE}
pacman::p_load(tidyverse, here, broom, gravity, panelr, plm, nlme, lmtest, stargazer, fixest)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
gravity_raw <- 
  read_csv(here("gravity.csv"))

gravity_one <- 
  gravity_raw |> 
  rename(iso_o = iso_i, iso_d = iso_j, trade = exports) |> 
  select(!imports)

gravity_two <- 
  gravity_raw |> 
  rename(iso_d = iso_i, iso_o = iso_j, trade = imports) |> 
  select(!exports)

gravity <- 
  gravity_one |> 
  bind_rows(gravity_two)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
gravity_ols <- 
  gravity |> 
  mutate(trade = log(trade + 1)) |> 
  panel_data(id = iso_o, wave = year)

formula_ols <- 
  trade ~ tgdp + rfe + sim + log(dist) + cont + lang + ccol + crel + rta
```

#### Pooled estimator

```{r, include=FALSE}
pooled_ols <- 
  plm(formula_ols,
      data = gravity_ols,
      model = 'pooling',
      index = c('iso_o'))

pooled_ols |> summary()
```

#### Random effects estimator

```{r, include=FALSE}
random_effects <- 
  plm(formula_ols,
      data = gravity_ols,
      index = c('iso_o'),
      model = 'random')

random_effects |> summary()
```

#### Fixed effects estimator

```{r, include=FALSE}
fixed_effects <- 
  plm(formula_ols,
      data = gravity_ols,
      index = c('iso_o'),
      model = 'within',
      effect = 'time')

fixed_effects |> summary()
```

#### Poisson pseudo-maximum-likelihood estimator

```{r, include=FALSE}
poisson <- 
  ppml(
  dependent_variable = 'trade',
  distance = 'dist',
  additional_regressors = c('tgdp', 'rfe', 'sim', 'cont', 'lang', 'ccol', 'crel', 'rta'),
  robust = FALSE,
  data = gravity
)

poisson |> summary()
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
formula_poisson <- 
  trade ~ 0 + tgdp + rfe + sim + log(dist) + cont + lang + ccol + crel + rta

poisson <- 
  glm(formula_poisson,
      family = quasipoisson(link = "log"),
      data = gravity)

poisson |> summary()
```

#### Hausman test

```{r, include=FALSE}
phtest(random_effects, fixed_effects)
```

Interpretation: <https://www.statisticshowto.com/hausman-test/>

### Poisson pseudo maximum likelihood

Alternative approach: <https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/fixest/vignettes/fixest_walkthrough.html>

```{r eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
feglm(exports ~ tgdp + rfe + sim + log(dist) + cont + 
          lang + ccol + crel + rta + 0 | factor(year), 
      #+ factor(iso_j), 
      exports_ppml, 
      family = quasipoisson(link = "log"))

feglm(imports ~ tgdp + rfe + sim + log(dist) + cont + 
          lang + ccol + crel + rta + 0 | factor(year), 
      #| factor(year) + factor(iso_j), 
      imports_ppml, 
      family = quasipoisson(link = "log"))
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
ppml_exports <- 
  glm(formula_exports_ppml,
      family = quasipoisson(link = "log"),
      data = exports_ppml)

ppml_exports |> summary()
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
ppml_imports <- 
  glm(formula_imports_ppml,
      family = quasipoisson(link = "log"),
      data = imports_ppml)

ppml_imports |> summary()
```

### Results

```{r, include=FALSE}
vars <- c("Suma bilateral del producto interno bruto",
          "Diferencia en la dotación relativa de factores",
          "Similitud en el tamaño de las economías",
          "Distancia entre principales centros urbanos",
          "Fronteras en común",
          "Lenguaje en común", 
          "Colonizador en común",
          "Índice de similitud en creencias religiosas",
          "Acuerdos comerciales regionales",
          "Constante")
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
rob_se <- list(sqrt(diag(vcovHC(pooled_ols, type = "HC1"))),
               sqrt(diag(vcovHC(random_effects, type = "HC1"))),
               sqrt(diag(vcovHC(fixed_effects, type = "HC1"))),
               sqrt(diag(vcovHC(poisson, type = "HC1"))))
```

```{r, results='asis', echo=FALSE}
stargazer(pooled_ols, random_effects, fixed_effects, poisson,
          column.labels = c("OLS", "REE", "FEE", "PPML"),
          omit = c("factor"),
          se = rob_se,
          covariate.labels = vars,
          dep.var.caption = "",
          dep.var.labels.include = FALSE,
          model.names = FALSE,
          model.numbers = TRUE,
          column.sep.width = "-5pt",
          font.size = "small",
          style = "qje",
          table.layout = "-c-#-t-s-n")
```
